definition: interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
fork in road/bifurcation/branch in road, river, mountain range etc/to branch off/to turn off/to diverge/to stray (from the path)/to change the subject/to interrupt/to stagger (times)

sentences.english: An interruption put it quite out of my head.
sentences.chinese: 一打岔我就把这事全忘了。

sentences.english: Examples include interruptions, some email and some phone calls.
sentences.chinese: 打岔的事，一些电子邮件和电话。

sentences.english: Numerous interruptions have prevented me from finishing the work.
sentences.chinese: 无数的打岔的事使我未能完成工作。

sentences.english: Don't interrupt me while I am talking.
sentences.chinese: 当我在跟别人说话时，不要打岔。

sentences.english: "Polly, " I groaned, "don't derail the discussion. The inference is wrong.
sentences.chinese: “波莉，”我抱怨道，“别打岔，这一推论是错误的。

sentences.english: Don't interrupt, let them talk and use silent pauses to encourage them to talk.
sentences.chinese: 不要打岔，在停顿时用沉默鼓励让他们多言。

sentences.english: I can' t finish this work because there are so many interruptions.
sentences.chinese: 我不能完成这项工作，因为打岔的事太多了。

sentences.english: I wish you wouldn't keep on interrupting.
Forgive me for interrupting, but I really don't agree with that.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我打岔，不过我确实不同意那一点。
他用一些愚蠢的问题打岔。

sentences.english: I hope you don't mind me barging in like this.
sentences.chinese: 希望你不介意我如此冒昧打岔。

sentences.english: Don't interrupt me when I talk.
sentences.chinese: 我说话的时候，请不能打岔。

sentences.english: Don’t interrupt. Just hear me out before you start talking.
sentences.chinese: 不要打岔，你等我把话讲完再说。

definition: to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to rebuke/to reprimand
to stop/to halt
to answer/to respond/to converse
lit. mention the pot that doesn't boil (idiom); to touch a sore spot/to talk about sb's weak point
pinyin: na3 hu2 bu4 kai1 ti2 na3 hu2

definition: one's proper business
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
to mediate/to broker a compromise
to have loose lips
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
